lines.gurmukhi: 1 gurU is`KwN dI krnI
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace if divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN gurisKwN jwie ijnw gur drsnu ifTw
lines.transliteration_english: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Jaai Jinaa Gur Darasanu Ditdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who go to have the glimpse of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN pYrI pY gur sBw bihTw
lines.transliteration_english: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Pairee Pai Gur Sabhaa Bahitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who touching the feet sit in the assembly of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN gurmiq bol boldy imTw
lines.transliteration_english: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Guramati Bol Boladay Mitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who speak sweet.

lines.gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN puqR imqR gurBweI ieTw
lines.transliteration_english: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Poutr Mitr Gur Bhaaee Itdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who prefer their fellow disciples to their sons and friends.

lines.gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN gur syvw jwxin AiBirTw
lines.transliteration_english: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Gur Sayvaa Jaanani Abhiritdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who love the service to the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN Awip qry qwryin sirTw
lines.transliteration_english: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Aapi Taray Taarayni Saritdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who get across and make other creatures also swim across.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK imilAw pwp pixTw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Miliaa Paap Panitdaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting such Gursikhs, all the sins are removed.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 gur is`KwN dw in`qnym

Shabad OS B.translation: Daily routine of Gursikhs

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN ipCl rwqI auiT bhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Pichhal Raatee Outdi Bahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who get up in the last quarter of night.

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN AMmiRq vylY sir nwvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Anmritu Vaylai Sari Naavanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who getting up in the ambrosial hours, and bathe in the holy tank.

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN hoie iek min gur jwpu jpMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Hoi Ik Mani Gur Jaapu Japanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who remember the Lord with single devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN swDsMgiq cil jwie juVMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Saadhasangati Chali Jaai Jurhanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs also who go to the holy congregation and sit there.

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN gurbwxI iniq gwie suxMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Gurabaanee Niti Gaai Sounanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who sing and listen to Gurbani daily.

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN mn mylI kir myil imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Mani Maylee Kari Mayli Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who meet others whole-heartedly.

lines.gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN Bwie Bgiq gurpurb krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Bhaai Bhagati Gurapurab Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who celebrate Guru’s anniversaries with full devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: gur syvw Plu suPlu PlMdy ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sayvaa Phalu Suphal Phaladay ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such Sikhs become blest by the service of the Guru and progress further successfully.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gur is`K dw ihrdw

Shabad OS B.translation: The heart of the Sikh of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw hodY qwix ju hoie inqwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Vitahu Vaariaa Hodai Taani Ju Hoi Nitaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who being mighty considers himself powerless.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw hodY mwix ju rhY inmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Vitahu Vaariaa Hodai Maani Ju Rahai Nimaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who being grand considers himself humble.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw Coif isAwxp hoie ieAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Vitahu Vaariaa Chhodi Siaanap Hoi Iaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who repudiating all cleverness becomes childlike

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw KsmY dw BwvY ijsu Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Vitahu Vaariaa Khasamai Daa Bhaavai Jisu Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who loves the will of the Master.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw gurmuK mwrgu dyiK luBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Vitahu Vaariaa Guramoukhi Maaragu Daykhi Loubhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who becoming gurmukh wishes to follow the way of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw clx jwix jugiq imhmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Vitahu Vaariaa Chalanu Jaani Jougati Mihamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who considers himself a guest in this world and keeps himself ready to depart from here.

lines.gurmukhi: dIn dunI drgh prvwxw ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Deen Dounee Daragah Paravaanaa ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a person is acceptable here and in the hereafter.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 gur is`K Aprs hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh is a detached one

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw gurmiq irdY grIbI AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Guramati Ridai Gareebee Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I love him deeply who cultivates humility through Gurmat, the wisdom of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw pr nwrI dy nyiV n jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Par Naaree Day Nayrhi N Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I love him deeply who does not go near another’s wife.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw prdrbY no hQu n lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Par Darabai No Hadu N Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I love him deeply who touches not the other’s wealth.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw pr inMdw suix Awpu htwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Par Nidaa Souni Aapu Hataavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I love him deeply who becoming indifferent to the backbiting of others detatches himself.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw siqgur dw aupdys kmwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Satigur Daa Oupadaysu Kamaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I love him deeply who listening to the teaching of the true Guru practices it in actual life.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw QoVw svY QoVw hI KwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Dorhaa Savai Dorhay Hee Khaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I love him deeply who sleeps little and eats little.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK soeI shij smwvY ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soee Sahaji Samaavai ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a gurmukh absorbs himself in the equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 gur is`K gRXwnI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Gursikh is a knowledgeable person

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY gur prmysru eyko jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Gur Paramaysaru Ayko Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who accepts Guru and God as one.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY dUjw Bwau n AMdir AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Doojaa Bhaau N Andari Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who does not allow the sense of duality to enter in him.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY Aaugux kIqy gux prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Aougounu Keetay Goun Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who understands the evil done to him as good one.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY mMdw iksY n AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Mandaa Kisai N Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who never speaks ill of anyone.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY Awpu Tgwey lokw BwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Aapu Tdagaaay Lokaa Bhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who is ready to suffer loss for the sake of others.

lines.gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY praupkwr kry rMg mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Paraoupakaar Karai Rang Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who enjoys doing altruistic activities.

lines.gurmukhi: laubwlI drgwh ivic mwxu inmwxw mwxu inmwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Laoubaalee Daragahi Vichi Maanu Nimaanaa Maanu Nimaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who enjoys doing altruistic activities.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUrw gur sbid is\\\\wxY ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooraa Gur Sabadu Siaanai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a humble person understanding the Word of Guru, himself becomes the perfect Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 is`K dI inSkwm AvsQw

Shabad OS B.translation: The selfless state of the Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN siqgur no imil Awpu gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Satigur No Mili Aapu Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, meeting the true Guru have lost their ego.

lines.gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN krn audwsI AMdir mwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Karani Udaasee Andari Maaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, while living amidst maya, remain indifferent to it.

lines.gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN gurimq gurcrxI icqu lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Guramati Gur Charanee Chitu Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, in accordance with Gurmat concentrate their mind on the feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN gur isK dy gur isK imlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Gur Sikh Day Gurasikh Milaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, imparting the teachings of the Guru make another disciple meet the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN bwhir jwNdw vrij rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Baahir Jaandaa Varaji Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, have resisted and bounded the outgoing mind.

lines.gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN Awsw ivic inrwsu vlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, while living among hopes and desires.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur dw aupdys idVHHwieAw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Daa Oupadays Dirhhaaiaa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Remain indifferent to them and learn steadfastly the teaching of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 bHmw dI krqUq

Shabad OS B.translation: Mischief of Brahma

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw vfw AKwiedw nwiB kvl dI nwil smwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Vadaa Akhaaidaa Naabhi Kaval Dee Naali Samaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Calling himself great, Brahma entered into the naval lotus (Of Visnu to know its end).

lines.gurmukhi: Awvw gvxu Anyk jug EVk ivic hoAw hYrwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Aavaa Gavanu Anayk Jag Aorhak Vichi Hoaa Hairaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For many ages he wandered in the cycle of transmigration and ultimately become dumbfounded.

lines.gurmukhi: EVku kIqosu Awpxw Awp gxwieAY Brim Bulwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Aorhaku Keetosu Aapanaa Aap Ganaaiai Bharami Bhulaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He left no stone unturned but remained misguided in his own so-called greatness.

lines.gurmukhi: cwry byd vKwxdw cqurmuKI hoie Krw isAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaaray Vayd Vakhaanadaa Chaturamoukhee Hoi Kharaa Siaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He becoming four-headed and wise would recite the four Vedas.

lines.gurmukhi: lokwN no smJwiedw dyiK sursqI rUp loBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Lokaan No Samajhaaidaa Vaykhi Surasatee Roop Lobhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would make people understand many things but seeing the beauty of his own daughter, Sarasvati, became enamoured.

lines.gurmukhi: cwry byd gvwie kY grbu grUrI kir pCuqwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaaray Vayd Gavaai Kai Garabu Garooree Kari Pachhoutaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He made his knowledge of the four Vedas futile. Proud as he became, he had to repent eventually.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw nyq nyq vKwxw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Nayt Nayt Vakhaanaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact the Lord is ineffable; in Vedas also He is also described as neti neti, (not this, not this).

lines.gurmukhi: 8 ds AvqwrwN dy krq`vRX

Shabad OS B.translation: Feats of the ten incarnations

lines.gurmukhi: ibsn ley Avqwr ds vYr ivroD joD sMGwry
lines.transliteration_english: Bisan Laay Avataar Das Vair Virodh Jodh Sanghaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Visnu incarnated ten times and decimated his opposing warriors.

lines.gurmukhi: mC kC vYrwh rUp hoie nrisMG bwvn bauDwry
lines.transliteration_english: Machh Kachh Vairaah Roopi Hoi Narasinghu Baavan Baudhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The incarnations in the forms of fish, tortoise, swine, man-lion, dwarf and Buddha etc. have happened.

lines.gurmukhi: prsrwmu rwmu iksnu hoie klik klMkI Aiq AhMkwry
lines.transliteration_english: Parasaraamu Raamu Kisanu Hoi Kilaki Kalakee Ati Ahankaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Parsu Ram, Ram, Kisan and very much proud incarnation of Kalki have flourished.

lines.gurmukhi: KqRI mwir iekIh vwr rwmwiex kir BwrQ Bwry
lines.transliteration_english: Khatree Maari Ikeeh Vaar Raamaain Kari Bhaarad Bhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ram was hero of Ramayan, and kisan was all in the mahabharat.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kroDu n swiDE loBu moh AhMkwru n mwry
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Karodhu N Saadhiao Lobhu Moh Ahankaaru N Maaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the lust and anger were not sublimited and greed, infatuation and ego were not eschewed.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur purKu n ByitAw swDsMgiq shlMg n swry
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Purakhu N Bhaytiaa Saadhasangati Sahalag N Saaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: None remembered the true Guru (God) and nobody benefited himself in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY AMdir kwir ivkwry ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Andari Kaari Vikaaray ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: All acted arrogantly being full of evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 mhwN dyv, iSv

Shabad OS B.translation: Mahadev, Siva ,

lines.gurmukhi: mhwdyau AauDUqu hoie qwms AMdir jogu n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaadayu Audhootu Hoi Taamas Andari Jogu N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though Mahadev was an ascetic of high order but being full of ignorance he could not even identify yoga.

lines.gurmukhi: BYro BUq kusUq ivc KyqRpwl bYqwl iD|wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhairo Bhoot Kousoot Vichi Khaytrapaal Baytaal Dhiaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He merely subordinated Bhairav, ghosts, Ksetrapals, and baitals (all malignant spirits).

lines.gurmukhi: Ak DqUrw Kwvxw rwqI vwsw mVHI mswxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aku Dhatooraa Khaavanaa Raatee Vaasaa Marhhee Masaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would eat akk ( a wild plant of sandy region – calotropis procera) and datura and lived in cemetery at night.

lines.gurmukhi: pYnY hwQI sIh Kl faurU vwie krY hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Painai Haadee Seeh Khal Dauroo Vaai Karai Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would wear the lion or elephant skin and would make people restive by playing on damaru (tabor).

lines.gurmukhi: nwQw nwQ sdwiedw hoie AnwQu n hir rMgu mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Naadaa Naadu Sadaaidaa Hoi Anaadu N Hari Rangu Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He was known as the nath (yogi) of the naths but never becoming masterless (anath) or humble did he remember God.

lines.gurmukhi: isriT sMGwrY qwmsI jogu n Bog n jugiq pCwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Siratdi Sanghaarai Taamasee Jogu N Bhogu N Jougati Pachhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: His main task was to destroy world malignantly. He would not understand the technique of enjoyment and repudiation (yoga).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu swD sMgwxY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Saadh Sangaanai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: One attains the fruits of pleasure be becoming a gurmukh a gurmukh and being in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 ieMdR qy bHmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Indr and Brahma

lines.gurmukhi: vfI Awrjw ieMdR dI ieMdR purI ivc rwju kmwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Vadee Aarajaa Indr Dee Indr Puree Vichi Raaju Kamaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Indr has a long age; he ruled indrpuri.

lines.gurmukhi: caudh ieMdR ivxwsukwil bHmy dw ieku idvsu ivhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudah Indr Vinaasu Kaali Brahamay Daa Iku Divasu Vihaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When fourteen Indrs are finished, the one day of Brahma passes I.e. in one day of Brahma fourteen Indrs rule.

lines.gurmukhi: DMDy hI bHmw mrY loms dw ieku rom iCjwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhandhay Hee Brahamaa Marai Lomas Daa Iku Rom Chhijaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the fall of one hair of Lomas Rishi, one Brahma is known to end his life (one can very well guess that like innumerable hair Brahmas are also many).

lines.gurmukhi: sys mhys vKwxIAin icrMjIv hoie swNiq n AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Says Mahays Vakhaaneeani Chiranjeev Hoi Saanti N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sesanag and Mahesa are also supposed to be living eternally but none has attained peace.

lines.gurmukhi: jog Bog jp qp Gxy lok vyd ismrxu n suhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jog Bhog Jap Tap Ghanay Lok Vayd Simaranu N Suhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: God does not like the hypocrisy of yoga, hedonism, recitation, asceticism, common customary acts etc.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gxwey n shij smwvY ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Ganaaay N Sahaji Samaavai ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who keeps his ego with him cannot merge in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 nwrdwidk irKI

Shabad OS B.translation: Rishi Narad and others

lines.gurmukhi: nwrdu munI AKwiedw Awgmu jwix n DIrju AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Naaradu Mounee Akhaaidaa Agamu Jaani N Dheeraju Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even being adept in the Vedas and Shastras Narad, the sage, had no forbearance.

lines.gurmukhi: suix suix msliq mjlsY kir kir cuglI AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Souni Souni Masalati Majalasai Kari Kari Chougalee Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would listen to the conversations of one assembly and would talk about it in the other.

lines.gurmukhi: bwl buiD snkwidkw bwl suBwie nivrqI hwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Baal Budhi Sanakaadikaa Baal Soubhaau Naviratee Haanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sanaks et al. also always reminded of the child wisdom and because of their restive nature they could never attain contentment and always suffered loss.

lines.gurmukhi: jwie bYkuMiT kroDu kir dyie srwpu jY ibjY iD|wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaai Baikountdi Karodhu Kari Dayi Saraapu Jaii Bijai Dhiaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They went to heaven and happened to curse Jay and Vijay, the door-keepers. Ultimately they had to repent.

lines.gurmukhi: AhMmyau sukdyau kr grB vwis haumY hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ahanmayu Soukadayu Kari Garabh Vaasi Haoumai Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of his ego Sukadev also suffered for a long time (twelve years) in the womb of his mother.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdu sUrju AaulMg BrY audY Asq ivic Awvx jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Chandu Sooraj Aulag Bharai Udai Asat Vichi Aavan Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sun and moon also full of blemishes, indulge in the cycle of rising and setting.

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI ivic grbu gumwxY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee Vichi Garabu Goumaanai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossed in maya they are all afflicted by ego.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 jqI sqI Awidk

Shabad OS B.translation: The celebates and virtuous etc.

lines.gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAw jq sq jugiq sMqoK n jwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Jatee Satee Santokheeaa Jat Sat Jougati Santokh N Jaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: So called celibates, virtuous and contented ones have also not understood contentment, the actual technique of celibacy and other virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: isD nwQu bhu pMQ kir haumY ivic krin krmwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Sidh Naadu Bahu Pand Kari Haoumai Vichi Karani Karamaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The siddhas and naths controlled by ego and divided into many sects roam hither and thither showing miraculous feats.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn sMswr ivic Kih Kih mrdy Brim BrwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Sansaar Vichi Khahi Khahi Maraday Bharami Bharaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the four varnas in the world going astray in delusions are clashing with one another.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsn hoie vriqAw bwrh vwt aucwt jmwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasan Hoi Varatiaa Baarah Vaat Ouchaat Jamaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Under the aegis of the six Shastras, yogis have adopted twelve ways and becoming indifferent to the world have gone away from its responsibilities.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK vrn Avrn hoie rMg surMg qMbol suhwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Varan Avaran Hoi Rang Surang Tanbol Suvaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh, who is beyond varnas and its further denominations, is like the betel leaf, which out of various colours adopts one steadfast colour (red) of all the virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruiq bwrh mwh ivic gurmuiK drsnu suJ suJwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Vichi Guramoukhi Darasanu Sujh Sujhaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the six seasons and twelve months as and when the gurmukh is visualized, he enlightens all like the sun of knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm iprwqI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Piraatee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The delightful fruit for gurmukhs is his love for the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 DrqI qy biR`C

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth and tree

lines.gurmukhi: pMj qq prvwxu kir Drmswl DrqI min BwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Panj Tat Paravaanu Kari Dharam Saal Dhratee Mani Bhaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As a result of the rational combination of five elements this lovely abode of dharma in the form of earth has been created.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI AMdir Driq Dir DrqI AMdir DirAw pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Andari Dharati Dhari Dharatee Andari Dhariaa Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth is placed in water and again in earth, water is placed.

lines.gurmukhi: isr qlvwey ruK hoie inhclu icq invwsu ibbwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Talavaaay Roukh Hoi Nihachalu Chit Nivaasu Bibaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having their heads downward i.e. the trees rooted in earth grow on it and reside in the deep lone forests.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwrI suPl Pil vt vgwie isriT vruswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaaree Suphal Phali Vat Vagaai Siratdi Varasaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: These trees are also altruists which when stoned rain fruits for the creatures on earth.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu vxwspq cMdnu hoie vwsu mihkwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Chandanu Hoi Vaasu Mahikaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fragrance of sandal makes the whole vegetation fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swDsMig gurmuiK suKPl AMmiRqvwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Anmrit Vaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy company of Gurmukhs the consciousness is merged into Word and man attains the fruits of delight through the ambrosial speech.

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq Aiq AkQ khwxI ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Gati Ati Akad Kahaanee ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ineffable is the story of the unmanifest Lord; His dynamism is unknowable.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 DÍwid skwm Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotes live Dhruv et al.

lines.gurmukhi: DRU piHlwdu BBIKxo AMbrIku bil jnk vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhr Prahilaadu Bhabheekhano Anbareeku Bali Janaku Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhru, Prahlad, Vibhisan, Ambris, Bali, Janak are well known personalities.

lines.gurmukhi: rwj kuAwr hoie rwjsI Awsw bMDI coj ivfwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Raaj Kuaar Hoi Raajasee Aasaa Bandhee Choj Vidaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They all were princes, and hence the rajas game of hope and desire was always on them.

lines.gurmukhi: DRU mqryeI cMifAw pIau PiV piHlwdu r\\\\wxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhr Matarayee Chandiaa Peeu Dharhi Prahilaadu Raanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhru was beaten up by his stepmother and Prahlad was caused to suffer by his father.

lines.gurmukhi: Byd BBIKxu lMk lY AMbrIku lY ckR luBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaydu Bhabheekhanu Lak Lai Anbareeku Lai Chakr Loubhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Vibhisan got Lanka by divulging the secrets of home and Ambris became happy seeing the Sudarsan chakr, as his protector (to save Ambris from the curse of Durvasa, Visnu had sent his chakr).

lines.gurmukhi: pYru kVwhY jnk dw kir pwKMf Drm iD|wxw
lines.transliteration_english: Pair Karhaa Hai Janak Daa Kari Paakhandu Dharam Dhitaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Janak by keeping one leg into the soft bedding and another into the boiling cauldron showed his power of hathayoga and let down the real dharma.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gxwie ivgucxw drgh pwey mwxu inmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai Vigouchanaa Daragah Paaay Maanu Nimaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The man who has eschewed his ego and has subsumed in the Lord is respected in the court of Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu piq prvwxw ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Pati Paravaanaa ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only Gurmukhs have attained the fruits of delight and only they are accepted (here and hereafter).

lines.gurmukhi: 15 nIc kul inSkwmu Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Low born selfless devotees

lines.gurmukhi: kljug nwmw Bgqu hoie Pyir dyhurw gwie ijvweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kalajougi Naamaa Bhagatu Hoi Dhayri Dayhuraa Gaai Jivaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In kaliyuga, a devotee named Namdev made the temple rotate and dead cow alive.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgqu kbIr vKwxIAY bMdI Kwny qy auiT jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagatu Kabeeru Vakhaaneeai Bandee Khaanay Tay Outdi Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is said Kabir used to go out of prison as and when he liked.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnw jtu auDwirAw sDnw jwiq Ajwiq ksweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannaa Jatu Udhaariaa Sadhanaa Jaati Ajaati Kasaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhanna, the jatt (farmer) and Sadhana born in a known low cast butcher got across the world ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: jnu rivdwsu cmwru hoie chu vrnwN ivic kir vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Janu Ravidaasu Chamaaru Hoi Chahu Varanaa Vichi Kari Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering Ravi Das a devotee of the Lord, all the four varnas praise him.

lines.gurmukhi: byix hoAw AiDAwqmI sYxu nIc kulu AMdir nweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bayni Hoaa Adhiaatamee Sainu Neechu Kulu Andari Naaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beni, the saint was a spiritualist, and born in a so-called low barber caste Sain was a devotee (of Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie gurisKwN ivic vfI smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Gurasikhaan Vichi Vadee Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Falling at and becoming the dust of the feet is the great trance for the Sikhs of the Guru (their caste should not be considered).

lines.gurmukhi: AlK lKwie n AlKu lKweI ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Alakhu Lakhaai N Alakhu Lakhaaee ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotees, though they behold the imperceptible Lord, yet do not disclose this to anyone.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 kljug dI au`qmqweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Superiority of the kaliyuga, in the dark age

lines.gurmukhi: siqjugu auqmu AwKIAY ieku PyVY sB dysu duhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Satijougu Outamu Aakheeai Iku Dhayrhai Sabh Daysu Duhaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Satyuga is said to be best but in it one committed sin and the whole country suffered.

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqY ngrI pIVIAY duAwpuir vMsu ivDuMsu kuvylw
lines.transliteration_english: Traytai Nagaree Peerheeai Duaapuri Vansu Vidhounsu Kuvaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In treta, one did the wrong act and the whole city would suffer.  In Duapar, sinful act of one person made the whole family suffer.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig scu inAwau hY jo bIjY so luxY iekylw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Sachu Niaau Hai Jo Beejai So Lounai Ikaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The justice of Kaliyuga is true because in it only he reaps who sows the evil seeds.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm sbid suriq siqgur gur cylw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooranu Brahamu Sabadi Surati Satiguroo Gur Chaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Brahm is the perfect Sabdabrahm and that disciple who merges his consciousness in the Sabdabrahm is in fact Guru and the true Guru (God).

lines.gurmukhi: nwm dwnu iesnwnu diRV swDsMgiq imil AMmiRq vylw
lines.transliteration_english: Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirh Saadhasangati Mili Anmrit Vaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sabdabrahm, the Guru is attained in the holy congregation by remembering the name of the Lord in the ambrosial hours.

lines.gurmukhi: imTw bolxu inv clxu hQhu dyxw shj suhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Mitdaa Bolanu Niv Chalanu Hadahu Daynaa Sahij Suhaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A mild spoken, humble and giver through his hands moves in equipoise and remains happy.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu nyhu nvylw ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukh Soukh Phal Nayhu Navaylaa ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ever new love of devotion to the Lord keeps the gurmukhs happy.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 vwihgurU mMqR

Shabad OS B.translation: Waheguru mantara

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwr Awkwru kir joiq srUp AnUp idKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaaru Aakaaru Kari Joti Saroopu Anoop Dikhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The formless Lord has been beholden in the form of the light (in Guru Nanak and other Gurus).

lines.gurmukhi: byd kqyb Agocrw vwihgurU gur sbdu suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Katayb Agocharaa Vaahiguroo Gur Sabadu Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurus recited Word-Guru as Vahiguru who is beyond the Vedas and Katebas (the semtic scriptures).

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn cwr mjhbw crx kvl srxwgiq AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Chaari Majahabaa Charan Kaval Saranaagati Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Therefore all the four varnas and all four semitic religions have sought the shelter of the lotus feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs pris Aprs jig AstDwqu ieku Dwqu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasi Parasi Aparas Jagi Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the Gurus in the form of Philosopher’s stone touched them, that alloy of eight metal changed into one metal (gold in the form of Sikhism).

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pwie invwiekY haumY rogu AswDu imtwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Paai Nivaaikai Haoumai Rogu Asaadhu Mitaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurus giving them place at their feet removed their incurable malady of ego.

lines.gurmukhi: hukim rjweI clxw gurmuiK gwfI rwhu clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Houkami Rajaaee Chalanaa Guramoukhi Gaadee Raahu Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For Gurmukhs they cleared the highway of God’s will.

lines.gurmukhi: pUry pUrw Qwtu bxwieAw ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Pooray Pooraa Daatu Banaaiaa ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: The perfect (Guru) made the perfect arrangements.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 gurmuK vrnx

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: jMmx mrxhu bwhry praupkwrI jg ivic Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Janmanu Maranahu Baaharay Paraoupakaaree Jag Vichi Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being beyond transmigration the altruists came in this world.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq aupdys kir swDsMgiq scKMf vswey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Oupadaysu Kari Saadh Sangati Sachakhandi Vasaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Preaching loving devotion, they, through the holy congregation reside in the abode of truth.

lines.gurmukhi: mwn srovir prmhMs gurmuiK sbd suriq ilv lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Sarovari Paramahans Guramoukhi Sabad Surati Liv Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs being swans of highest order (paramhains) keep their consciousness merged in Word, the Brahm.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vws vxwspiq APl sPl cMdn mihkwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Aphal Saphal Chandan Mahakaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are like sandal, which makes the fruitful and fruitless vegetation fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: Bvjl AMdir bohQY hoie prvwr su pwr lMGwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhavajal Andari Bohadai Hoi Paravaar Sadhaar Laghaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Into the world ocean they are like that vessel which takes the whole family across comfortably.

lines.gurmukhi: lhir qrMgu n ivAwpeI mwieAw ivic audwsu rhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Lahari Tarangu N Viaapaee Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They remain undistributed and detached amid the waves of worldly phenomena.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu sihj smwey ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sahaji Samaaay ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Remaining absorbed in the equipoise is the delightful fruit if the gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 Ajr jrxw

Shabad OS B.translation: To bear the unbearable

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu gurU gur isK DMnu Awid purKu Awdysu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Guroo Gur Sikhu Dhannu Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The blest is disciple as well as the Guru who has made the disciple to pray before the primeval Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur drsn DMnu hY DMn idsit gur iDAwnu DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Darasanu Dhannu Hai Dhann Disati Gur Dhiaanu Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blessed is the glimpse of the true Guru and that vision is also blessed one which peeps the mind concentrated upon the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu siqgur sbdu DMnu suriq gur igAwnu suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Sabadu Dhannu Surati Gur Giaanu Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Word of the true Guru and that meditational faculty is also blessed which has made the mind sustain the true knowledge bestowed by Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl gur DMnu DMnu DMnu msqku gur crxI lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Gur Dhannu Dhannu Dhannu Masataku Gur Charanee Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blessed are the lotus feet of the Guru along with that forehead which rests upon the feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu gur aupdysu hY DMnu irdw gurmMqR vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Gur Oupadaysu Hai Dhannu Ridaa Guramantr Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Auspicious is the teaching of the Guru and that heart is a blessed one wherein resides the Guru manta.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu guru crxwmqo DMnu muhqu ijqu AipE pIAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Guru Charanaamato Dhannu Mahatu Jitu Apiao Peeaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Auspicious is the wash of Guru’s feet’s and that wisdom is also blessed one which understanding its importance has tasted that rare nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Ajru jrwieAw ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukhu Phalu Ajaru Jaraaiaa ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way, the gurmukhs have endured the unsustainable delight of the fruit of Guru’s Glimpse.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 swD sMg mihmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Grandeur of the holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: suK swgru hY swDsMgu soBw lihr qrMg Aqoly
lines.transliteration_english: Soukh Saagaru Hai Saadhasangu Sobhaa Lahari Tarang Atolay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation is that ocean of delight in which the waves of Lord’s praise adorn it.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxk moqI hIirAw gur aupdysu Avysu Amoly
lines.transliteration_english: Maanak Motee Heeriaa Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Amolay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriad rubies diamonds and pearls in the form of Guru’s teachings exist in this ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: rwg rqn Anhd DunI sbid suriq ilv Agm Aloly
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Ratan Anahad Dhounee Sabadi Surati Liv Agam Alolay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Musicality here is like a jewel and merging their consciousness in the rhythm of the unstruck Word, the listeners listen to it with rapt attention.

lines.gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD sB golIAwN cwir pdwrQ goiel goly
lines.transliteration_english: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Sabh Goleeaan Chaari Padaarad Goil Golay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Here the miraculous powers are subservient and the four ideals of life (dharm, arth, kam and moks) are servants and being transitory does not attract the attention of the people who reached this stage.

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK cMd crwgcI lK lK AMmiRq pIcin Joly
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Chand Charaagachee Lakh Lakh Anmrit Peechani Jholay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriad means here work as lamps and myriad men getting elated quaff the nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: kwmDynu lK pwrjwq jMgl AMdir crin Afoly
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamadhaynu Lakh Paarijaat Jangal Andari Charani Adolay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriad of wish fulfilling cows gaze delightfully in the forest of wish fulfilling trees.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Plu bol Aboly ]20]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Bol Abolay ?20?12?baaraan?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact the pleasure fruit of the gurmukhs is ineffable.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: jau lau Anrs bis qau lau nhI pRym rsu jau lau Awn iDAwn Awpw Awpu nhI dyKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jau Lau Anaras Basi Tau Lau Nahee Praym Rasu , Jau Lau Aan Dhiaan Aapaa Aapu Nahee Daykheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: So long a human being remains absorbed in worldly attractions and pleasures, he cannot know love. So long his attention is focused on something else, he cannot realize self.

lines.gurmukhi: jau lau Awn igAwn qau lau nhI AiDAwqm igAwn jau lau nwd bwd n Anwhd ibsyKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jau Lau Aan Giaan Tau Lau Nahee Adhiaatam Giaana , Jau Lau Naad Baad N Anaahad Bisaykheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: (Renouncing Lord) as long as one is busy acquiring knowledge of mundane worldly things, he remains bereft of spiritual wisdom. As long as one remains involved in worldly pleasures one cannot hear the unstruck celestial music of divine word.

lines.gurmukhi: jau lau AhMbuiD suiD hoie n AMqir giq jau lau n lKwvY qau lau AlK n lyKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jau Lau Ahanbudhi Sudhi Hoi N Antari Gati , Jau Lau N Lakhaavai Tau Lau Alakh N Laykheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As long as one remains proud and arrogant, one cannot realise self. Till such time True Guru does not initiate a person with the boon of Lord's name and propitiate the Lord, one cannot realise the 'formless God'.

lines.gurmukhi: siq rUp siqnwm siqgur igAwn iDAwn eyk hI Anyk myk eyk eyk ByKIAY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Roop Satinaam Satigur Giaan Dhiaana , Ayk Hee Anayk Mayk Ayk Ayk Bhaykheeai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The knowledge of Almighty lies in the consecrating words of the True Guru that leads one to reality of His name and form. By uniting his mind with His name, the Lord who prevails in various forms gets revealed. (12)
